messages.message:
Hi, i’m finding loading a shared workspace is really slow and i’m getting a lot of errors in the console and for some requests to `aihub/build/projects/bulk/lock` . The page does eventually load, but seems like there is something wrong going on here.

@hannah
@Paul H we should only call the lock endpoint inside a build project right? This seems unrelated to the actual error Lee is experiencing though
Thanks for flagging this - adding in @Weiming Wu and @Elan Sharony to help take a look
we’re calling this to get edited time for the project. btw lee, your screenshot is very low res

This is the large error.

```ibapp_aihub.bundle.js?v=1701889616.3780065:3381 Error: Error occured while getting project intentions. Error: Error occurred executing GRPC method: Request /ai_hub_service.AIHubService/GetProjectIntentions failed. Error code=INTERNAL, Error=(13, 'internal'), Message: Panic Triggered: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference. Non-retriable error. hey team, thanks for flagging the issue @Lee. A couple things:
• On the panic error, looks like we just missed a backport to 23.47. This issue is fixed for 23.49. We have until 12/18 for 49 to go GA- should we backport to 23.47 to unblock for the rest of the week? cc @hannah 
• On the slowness, investigating now. Will post here with findings/any fixes
slowness is probably from the panic error as it retries many times and each of those requests probably takes a bit
I think we should be fine waiting until 23.49

I'm not noticing any slowness with the bulk lock endpoint specifically, but it seems like the bottleneck is the bulk endpoint to list all projects (GET /projects). On my local, seeing a response time on the order of a few seconds for 20+ projects. Just created this ticket which we'll tackle for 24.02: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/FLOW-8154
